content.title: Haryana Shubhra Jyotsna Pension Scheme
content.department: General Administration Department, Government of Haryana
content.beneficiary: Residents of Haryana who participated actively during the period of emergency
content.details: The scheme was launched on 16th April 2018 to provide a monthly pension of ₹10,000/- to residents of Haryana who faced imprisonment during the emergency period from 25.06.1975 to 21.03.1977 under the MISA Act, 1971 and/or Defence of India Act, 1962.
benefits: Monthly pension of ₹10,000/- for eligible residents of Haryana.
eligibility: Residents of Haryana who participated actively during the emergency and faced imprisonment.
Must produce a jail certificate issued by Jail Superintendent and countersigned by District Magistrate.
If unable to produce a jail certificate, a certificate from two co-prisoners authenticated by an MLA or MP is acceptable.
Sufferers receiving a pension from another State Government for the same purpose may have their pension reduced.
Domicile of another State but arrested in Haryana is also eligible.
documents_required: Self-declaration of not receiving any Honorarium/Salary from State Government
Jail certificate issued by Jail Superintendent and counter-signed by District Magistrate
Affidavit stating not applied from any other district
Affidavit for Jail Tenure or For No Other Pension (From other states)
Jail Certificate or Affidavit of two Co-Prisoners
Death certificate of husband if widow

faqs.question: What is the 'Haryana Shubhra Jyotsna Pension Scheme' scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides a monthly pension of ₹10,000/- to residents of Haryana who faced imprisonment during the emergency period.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: General Administration Department, Government of Haryana.

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The scheme was launched on 16th April 2018.

faqs.question: When did this scheme come into force?
Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Residents of Haryana who faced imprisonment during the emergency period and widows of such persons.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Haryana State?
faqs.answer: Yes, but it also applies to those arrested and jailed in Haryana State.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Eligible residents will receive a monthly pension of ₹10,000/-.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to produce the jail certificate?
faqs.answer: Yes, a jail certificate is required unless a co-prisoner certificate is provided.

faqs.question: Is a person eligible for a pension if he/she is getting a pension from another State Government?
faqs.answer: Yes, but the pension may be reduced if it is for the same purpose.

faqs.question: Who will receive the pension in case of the demise of any of the Emergency Sufferers?
faqs.answer: The monthly pension will continue to be given to the surviving spouse.

faqs.question: Can an applicant apply from more than one district?
faqs.answer: No, the applicant can apply from only one district.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible applicant may apply online.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply online under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Visit the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
